author: Jamie Schram
title: Inside the $1M jewel heist at Simon Cowell’s mansion | Page Six
text:
A serial burglar ripped off $1 million in jewelry after climbing security walls and carrying out a daring pre-dawn raid on Simon Cowell ’s London mansion two years ago, prosecutors said Wednesday.
Darren February, 34, forced his way into the music mogul’s house in tony West London by accessing a rear patio door after trying to enter through the front door as an unsuspecting Cowell slept inside, prosecutor Denis Barry told the jury in opening remarks at the homeless man’s theft trial.
Cowell’s girlfriend, Lauren Silverman, their 2-year-old son, Eric, and a nanny were also snoozing inside the home at the time of December 2015 burglary, The Daily Mail reported .
February, a career criminal, swiped various pieces of jewelry and two passports belonging to Cowell, from an open safe in a bedroom wardrobe closet, Barry told jurors in London’s Isleworth Crown Court, the newspaper said.
As February fled the residence with a bag of stolen baubles, he dropped one of the passports, a pair of gloves and some of the jewels when he was confronted by a security guard, M’Batonha Mendes, Barry said.
Police later recovered the second passport at a sanitation facility.
Two forensic experts were expected to testify that February’s DNA was found on the gloves, The Mail said.
February also made the mistake of stopping to catch his breath and making a handprint on one of the security walls as he propped himself up outside the property.
Simon Cowell and Lauren Silverman with their son Eric Getty Images “It would appear from the CCTV that the burglar is catching his breath because he had to shimmy over lots of different walls to get in to the premises and around the premises,” Barry said.
Mendez, who was working for a private security firm, was sitting in a car when he spotted February walking nearby with the bag of stolen baubles and discarding some of the items.
“[Mendez] caught up with the man and said ‘just a second,’” Barry explained.
“The man continued to walk away from him. He was walking in the direction of Holland Park area. He was carrying a brown leather satchel like bag,” Barry said.
“The burglar suddenly turned round to face Mr. Mendez and said ‘What do you want, what do you want’ and then started to run,” the prosecutor said.
“And he was pursued by Mr. Mendez. The burglar dropped the bag and we know he was the burglar because he dropped the proceeds of the burglary,” Barry said, adding that February has racked up 37 theft-related arrests.
Another prosecutor, Kevin Christie, said the jewelry belonged to Silverman with an estimated value of $1 million. The stolen pieces included several watches, diamond rings, diamond earrings and diamond bracelets.
In a statement read to the jury, Cowell said, “No one has the right or authority to steal from Lauren or myself and I will go to court if required.”
The British entertainer is best known for his brutal judging style on reality shows such as “American Idol.”
